Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery cup, type B; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of youth wearing a short chiton with corslet and brown inner markings bending down, to right, donning a greave; at right, lower end of undetermined object, possibly a scabbard; relief-contour and preliminary sketch.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 515, no. C91)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0658) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (p. 13, pl. XIV, no. 22)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
